intro: Hieracium basifurcum, commonly known as the basal-fruited hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets and tubular disc florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium basifurcum is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it is considered a weed in some regions.
